intro: Calochortus clavatus var. recurvifolius, commonly known as the recurved globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, salmon-pink to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and recurved, giving it a distinctive appearance. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes several species of flowering plants known for their ornamental value.
